alert.note: Alert for La Paz; Maricopa; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued September 02 at 7:21PM MST until September 02 at 8:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Southeastern La Paz County in west central Arizona... Northeastern Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... * Until 815 PM MST. * At 721 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 13 miles northwest of Tonopah to near Vicksburg Junction, moving south at 45 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 35 and 87. US Highway 60 between mile markers 37 and 52. AZ Route 72 between mile markers 44 and 49. Locations impacted include... Kofa Wildlife Refuge, Vicksburg, Vicksburg Junction, Sundad, Palm Canyon and Hyder. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
